page.title: 03The old village,Llanddulas.
page.content: It's hard to say how old the old village is,for it started as only a few farm houses. In the 5th century damage occurred to the church,and papers were found proving that there was a church.The first church was originally whitewashed but is now grey stone.Many of the houses in the old village were knocked down 12 years ago by Price Brothers to make room for the new estate.There is still much of the old village left.It goes up Minffordd Rd. and along Abergele Rd.You can tell the old houses from the new because the old houses are grey stone like the present day church.The stone is local limestone from Llanddulas Quarry. People call the old village Llan, meaning Church,because most of the old village was clustered around the St. Cynbryd's church.
